content:
Yes, I am familiar with the "Encyclopedia of Occultism & Parapsychology" by Leslie Shepard. It is a reference book that covers a wide range of topics related to the occult and parapsychology, including spiritualism, magic, astrology, and psychic phenomena.

The first edition of the encyclopedia was published in 1978, and it has since been revised and expanded in subsequent editions. It contains entries on a wide range of subjects, from historical figures like Aleister Crowley and Helena Blavatsky to paranormal events like poltergeists and UFO sightings.

The "Encyclopedia of Occultism & Parapsychology" is considered to be one of the most comprehensive reference books on the subject, and it has been praised for its thoroughness and accuracy. It is a valuable resource for anyone interested in the study of the paranormal, occult, and related fields.
